Jesus was born in Bethlehem
According to the New Testament, Jesus was born in Bethlehem of Judea (Matthew 2:1).
Moses parted the Red Sea
In the book of Exodus, Moses led the Israelites out of Egypt and parted the Red Sea with God's power (Exodus 14:21-22).
Paul was one of the 12 Apostles
Paul was not one of the original 12 apostles; he became a prominent apostle after Jesus' resurrection and appeared to him (Acts 9).
David defeated Goliath
The young David defeated the Philistine giant Goliath with a sling and a stone (1 Samuel 17).
Noah built an ark
Noah built an ark under God's instructions to survive the flood (Genesis 6-9).
Peter denied Jesus three times
Jesus predicted Peter's denial, and Peter denied knowing Jesus three times (Luke 22:54-62).
The Bible has 66 books
The Protestant Bible contains 66 books: 39 in the Old Testament and 27 in the New Testament.
Jesus turned water into wine at a wedding
Jesus performed his first miracle of turning water into wine at a wedding in Cana (John 2:1-11).
The Ten Commandments were given to Joshua
The Ten Commandments were given to Moses on Mount Sinai, not to Joshua (Exodus 20).
Solomon was known for his wisdom
King Solomon was known for his great wisdom, a gift from God (1 Kings 3:12).
Jesus was crucified in Nazareth
Jesus was crucified in Jerusalem, not in Nazareth (Matthew 27:32-50).
Jonah was swallowed by a whale
The prophet Jonah was swallowed by a large fish after fleeing from God's command (Jonah 1:17).
Abraham was asked to sacrifice Isaac
God tested Abraham's faith by asking him to sacrifice his son Isaac (Genesis 22:1-19).
The Gospel of Luke is the first book of the New Testament
The first book of the New Testament is the Gospel of Matthew.
Esther became queen of Egypt
Esther became queen of Persia, not Egypt (Esther 2:17).
Daniel was thrown into a lion's den
Daniel was thrown into a lion's den for refusing to pray to the king instead of God (Daniel 6).
Ruth was a Moabite
Ruth was from Moab, and she followed her mother-in-law Naomi to Israel (Ruth 1:4).
Elijah ascended to heaven in a chariot of fire
The prophet Elijah was taken up to heaven in a chariot of fire (2 Kings 2:11).
John the Baptist baptized Jesus
John the Baptist baptized Jesus in the Jordan River (Matthew 3:13-17).
The Book of Psalms is in the New Testament
The Book of Psalms is in the Old Testament.
